14026016.review:
JumpJet Rex is an arcade platformer designed to be rewarding and satisfying at any level of play. There is no difficulty option; you're set on course with all the necessary tools at your discression to simply have fun with the game, or make it a competitive speed runner to climb the leaderboards against your friends.

Each level has a prime directive which is to get to the goal at no matter the cost, however you're awarded extra stars for completing a level with out dying, or reaching the goal in record time; however, like any good retro-inspired platformer, you're rewarded in your efforts for exploring and collecting coins. Scattered throught out most, if not all levels, there's secret warpzones and costumes for you to collect and buy to decorate Rex in your own fashion.

The art is top notch, and each level is a vibrant landscape that you'll probably come back to multiple times again to beat your fastest time, and earn coins, and the music is excellent that - you'll probably get a few tunes stuck in your head in the same fashion Strike the Earth from Shovel Knight has become an instant classic much like the classic theme from Mario Brothers and other games.

JumpJet Rex is a solid platformer that everyone should try regardless of the title of "early access" being plastered on it's store page. Support TreeFortress and their games, I'm thoroughly excited for what more this game will offer.

Dinosaurs have actually lived among us for millions of years on a small tropical island called Isla Nublar. What was once believed to be  a hollywood movie, "Jurassic Park" turned out to be an actual real documentary about the events that took place on the island and documented the attempts that humans  tried to gain control over these dominant creatures.

Due to unlawful experimentation the humans were able to give the dinosaurs extreme human like intelligence. It would ultimately be the downfall of mankind. Ever so tired of the villany of the humans, the dinosaurs rebeled against their captures and soon regained control of the island. Any attempts to reach the island were met with failure.

For many years the dinosaurs planned a way to rid the world of the human race. Using the data collected from the scienist that worked there, the dinosaurs were able to construct and weaponize a lethal dna virus that could kill the humans with imediate exposure. Once unleashed , the virus quickly spread; wiping out the entire human population. Dinosaurs once again ruled the earth.

Over 5,000 years have passed since the virus wiped out humanity. As time went on the dinosaurs intelligence continued to grow as did their techonology. To overcome their problems with moblity they designed space ships and rocket boots that allowed them to move with great ease. It wasn't long after they started to colonize space, setting up many space stations and offworld colonies. The second era of dinosaurs looked bright.

Alas  not all was well in the universe. A dark long forgotten force had grown angry at the dinosaurs. In it's anger it summoned a huge meteor to crash on the dinosaurs home planet earth hoping to wipe them out from existance.

Now as a first responder: JumpJetRex, you must save your home planet from annihilation. Using your wits, and of course your rocket boots; you must overcome the many challanges that face you ahead. The fate of the planet rests in your hands.

Dinosaurs- check
Space- Check
Rocket Boots- Check
A damn fun time?- Check

10/10

So this is a pretty interesting game. I never thought a game about a T-Rex in space with rockets strapped to his feet would be so addicting (mainly because I never thought about a T-Rex in space with rockets strapped to his feet). But it's quite a nice game. The controls are very tight, though the movement is by design not "stop on a dime" due to you know... flying. And rocket engine propelling. You need to know you're gonna stop and kind of plan your routes about 1/2 second in advance, and BOY is it addicting.

This game will be speedrunners' dreams I think. No glitches, just pure timing and trying again and again XD.

Oh, and it can get quite difficult too. Some levels had me cursing like crazy, but you don't want to stop. It's like a light, colourful, 2D Dark Souls Sen's Fortress where you die in 1 touch from anything and you can't attack but there are no enemies. Yes. That's basically it. At times difficult as hell, but so satisfying when you DO IT.

Do I recommend it? I sure do. Especially for the price. It's only going to get better from here on out. And oh boy... THE MUSIC. YESSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS THE MUSICCCCCCCCCC. It's so good.

14011541.review:
I've gotten through the first boss and have really enjoyed it so far. The first boss was fairly straightforward once I realized I could shoot lasers from my boots, but still quite a challenge to beat without dying.

Which brings up the most interesting aspect of this game: The DIY difficulty. Any level can be completed by simply hammering through it and dying endlessly (all items collected are saved), but you'll only get one star. The other two are for not dying, or doing it under a certain time. I really liked this because it gave me a reason for going back, but also didn't halt my progress when I encountered a particularly difficult (for me) level. It's also much better than the seemingly arbitrary stars given out in Angry Birds.

As far as the mechanics go, I can safely say this game plays great with a keyboard and mouse. The controls are tight, and when I die it was annoyance with myself for rushing and not being careful, never with the game itself for being unfair.

Definitely recommend to regular and casual players alike, but if Super Meatboy is more your thing, this game (thankfully imo) is not that level of difficulty.

If you'd like to see a video of me playing the first few levels and first boss, I've included it below. Fair Warning though: this video was done as a "Let's Play" mostly for my friends at work, so it contains commentary and all together too much swearing. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S-AWPNNpTHg
